alert.note: Alert for Lower Hudson Valley (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 07 at 6:37AM EDT until April 07 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR THE LOWER HUDSON VALLEY... The National Weather Service in Upton has issued a Red Flag Warning for the Lower Hudson Valley, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM EDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Lower Hudson Valley. * TIMING...Late this morning into early this evening. * WINDS...Northwest 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 22 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the lower 50s. * LIGHTNING...None. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are expected or occurring. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry fuels will create a significantly elevated fire growth potential.
